element.name: Sal's Gap by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

long-description.p: Sally Gap is the highest crossroads in Ireland. According to one local legend St. Patrick died here and was taken off to paradise on a white steed by Oisín. Sally Gap comes from "gap in the saddle" (Bearnas na diallaite in Irish), referring to St. Patrick’s space on the horse behind Oisín presumably, and is nothing to do with the actual shape of the gap or willow trees. The area around the Sally Gap and Luggala is one of the most scenic of Wicklow, the Garden County.

There is a rocking stone near the Sally Gap, which Celtic druids used to determine whether someone was innocent or guilty of a particular crime. It was a huge big boulder that sat precariously on top of a smaller stone. The accused would be made lie under it and if the top stone fell on his head and killed him before he confessed then he was obviously guilty.
The cache is a decon container please rehide it with care to prevent the passing muggles from discovering its location.

element.encoded-hints: Cache is a decon box cliped onto a heather bush it should be easy to spot as there is no camo involved

ul.li:
2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by eve1987
:( could not found it, but many AWFUL dust..

2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Didn't find it by GudrunXY
We looked and looked but nothing here to find for us. [:(] What we really didn't like was the waste just next to the search place. GudrunXY

2010-04-17T19:00:00Z : Found it by abra123cadabra
Well, in theory such a container should be easy to spot... but where do you start spotting? I found it by the rattling sound nearby when one of the little cachers walked past. At least there are no trees around that could influence the GPSr. Finally I could cross this one from my list of previous DNFs.

2010-03-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by Peta Amalka
Found it after little bit of searching. TFTC

2010-02-28T20:00:00Z : Found it by nisse_perlemo
Not easy to find, well camouflaged. Got it after some rummaging around in the heather. Very cold day. TFTC

wpt.name: GC1J8H5
wpt.desc: Sal's Gap by Windsockers, Traditional Cache (1/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Sal's Gap
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Sals Gap

Sally Gap is the highest crossroads in Ireland. According to one local legend St. Patrick died here and was taken off to paradise on a white steed by Oisín. Sally Gap comes from "gap in the saddle" (Bearnas na diallaite in Irish), referring to St. Patrick’s space on the horse behind Oisín presumably, and is nothing to do with the actual shape of the gap or willow trees. The area around the Sally Gap and Luggala is one of the most scenic of Wicklow, the Garden County.

There is a rocking stone near the Sally Gap, which Celtic druids used to determine whether someone was innocent or guilty of a particular crime. It was a huge big boulder that sat precariously on top of a smaller stone. The accused would be made lie under it and if the top stone fell on his head and killed him before he confessed then he was obviously guilty.

The Cache

The cache is a decon container please rehide it with care to prevent the passing muggles from discovering its location.



The Windsockers
